formalpara.title: Figure 7. Subcellular localization of SEC-23 and PDI-2 in C. elegans
formalpara.para: (A) DPY-7 (green) and PDI-2 (red) double staining of a 1.5-fold embryo. At this stage both PDI-2 and DPY-7 are co-localised in the ER (yellow). (B) DPY-7 (green) and PDI-2 (red) double staining of an elongated embryo. At this stage DPY-7 (green) has been secreted and is present in the newly formed cuticle. PDI-2 (red) remains resident in the ER. (C and D) PDI-2 (red) and SEC-23::GFP (green) localisation in early comma stage embryos. Two images of the same embryo taken at focal planes 1 μm apart. SEC-23 localises to foci on the surface of the ER as defined by the ER marker PDI-2.
